provisions.content: The objects of the Fund are to maximize the value of the income due the Republic from the mineral wealth of the country for the benefit of its citizens; maximize the value of the income due the Republic from the mineral wealth of the country for the benefit of its citizens; monetise the minerals income accruing to the Republic in a beneficial, responsible, transparent, accountable and sustainable manner; and monetise the minerals income accruing to the Republic in a beneficial, responsible, transparent, accountable and sustainable manner; and develop and implement measures to reduce the budgetary exposure of the Republic to minerals income fluctuations. develop and implement measures to reduce the budgetary exposure of the Republic to minerals income fluctuations.

(5) Income accruing to the Republic from minerals paid to the Fund by a mining company shall Income accruing to the Republic from minerals paid to the Fund by a mining company shall not be classified as taxes paid by the mining companies and shall not be expended as conventional tax revenue paid to the Government; and not be classified as taxes paid by the mining companies and shall not be expended as conventional tax revenue paid to the Government; and be considered as paid to the Government under the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) and any Minerals Investment Agreement. be considered as paid to the Government under the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) and any Minerals Investment Agreement.

provisions.title: Payment of minerals in place of royalties
provisions.content: (1) Where the Government elects for payment of royalty and any other related payment to be made in minerals instead of cash m accordance with law and applicable Minerals Investment Agreement, the value of the minerals in United States Dollars on the day the minerals are received by or on behalf of the Government shall be reported and recorded by the Ghana Revenue Authority as payments to the Fund. Where the Government elects for payment of royalty and any other related payment to be made in minerals instead of cash m accordance with law and applicable Minerals Investment Agreement, the value of the minerals in United States Dollars on the day the minerals are received by or on behalf of the Government shall be reported and recorded by the Ghana Revenue Authority as payments to the Fund. (2) The proceeds of the sale of the minerals shall be credited to the Fund within sixty calendar days after the receipt of the minerals from the mining company. The proceeds of the sale of the minerals shall be credited to the Fund within sixty calendar days after the receipt of the minerals from the mining company.

provisions.title: Transfer of mineral equity interests
provisions.content: (1) All mineral equity interests and all rights and liabilities arising out of the mineral equity interests held in the name of the Republic are transferred to and shall vest in the Fund. All mineral equity interests and all rights and liabilities arising out of the mineral equity interests held in the name of the Republic are transferred to and shall vest in the Fund. (2) The Fund may, with the prior consent of the Minister, transfer any mineral equity interest vesting in the Fund and all rights and liabilities arising out of the mineral equity interests to a Special Purpose Vehicle. The Fund may, with the prior consent of the Minister, transfer any mineral equity interest vesting in the Fund and all rights and liabilities arising out of the mineral equity interests to a Special Purpose Vehicle.

provisions.title: Disbursement of moneys of the Fund
provisions.content: (1) The Fund shall, not later than three days after receipt of any mineral income, distribute the amount due and payable into the designated account of the Minerals Development Fund in accordance with the Minerals Development Fund Act, 2016 (Act 912). The Fund shall, not later than three days after receipt of any mineral income, distribute the amount due and payable into the designated account of the Minerals Development Fund in accordance with the Minerals Development Fund Act, 2016 (Act 912). (2) The moneys of the Fund shall be disbursed in accordance with this Act, the Investment Policy Statement and the terms of any allocation agreement that has been entered into by the Fund and ratified in accordance with subsection (2) of section 41. The moneys of the Fund shall be disbursed in accordance with this Act, the Investment Policy Statement and the terms of any allocation agreement that has been entered into by the Fund and ratified in accordance with subsection (2) of section 41. (3) The Fund shall disburse minerals investment income received by the Fund in accordance with the Investment Policy Statement and any directives by the Minister. The Fund shall disburse minerals investment income received by the Fund in accordance with the Investment Policy Statement and any directives by the Minister.

provisions.title: Bank accounts
provisions.content: (1) Minerals income and income from investments and other receipts of the Fund shall vest in the Fund and shall be paid into bank accounts opened by the Fund with the approval of the Controller and Accountant-General. Minerals income and income from investments and other receipts of the Fund shall vest in the Fund and shall be paid into bank accounts opened by the Fund with the approval of the Controller and Accountant-General. (2) Subject to the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921), the Fund and any Special Purpose Vehicle may open, maintain and operate bank accounts in foreign currency both within and outside the Republic and receive payments in any currency, including the accounts of the Fund and retain the proceeds in and make payments from the accounts as the Fund considers fit. Subject to the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921), the Fund and any Special Purpose Vehicle may open, maintain and operate bank accounts in foreign currency both within and outside the Republic and receive payments in any currency, including the accounts of the Fund and retain the proceeds in and make payments from the accounts as the Fund considers fit.

provisions.title: Foreign currency arrangements
provisions.content: (1) The Fund or a Special Purpose Vehicle may, subject to the Bank of Ghana Regulations and any other relevant laws The Fund or a Special Purpose Vehicle may, subject to the Bank of Ghana Regulations and any other relevant laws transfer foreign currency into Ghana; transfer foreign currency into Ghana; purchase local currency at the prevailing interbank exchange rate or at any other rate approved by the Bank of Ghana and convert local currency into foreign currency at the prevailing interbank exchange rate or at any other rate approved by the Bank of Ghana; purchase local currency at the prevailing interbank exchange rate or at any other rate approved by the Bank of Ghana and convert local currency into foreign currency at the prevailing interbank exchange rate or at any other rate approved by the Bank of Ghana; transfer, export and hold foreign currency outside of Ghana. transfer, export and hold foreign currency outside of Ghana. obtain and use letters of credit and guarantees in foreign currency; obtain and use letters of credit and guarantees in foreign currency; except in respect of costs incurred in Ghana to suppliers of goods or services who are residents of Ghana which shall be paid in Ghana Cedis, utilise foreign currency in Ghana without restriction; and except in respect of costs incurred in Ghana to suppliers of goods or services who are residents of Ghana which shall be paid in Ghana Cedis, utilise foreign currency in Ghana without restriction; and pay in foreign currency any amounts due to foreign counterparties and from the Fund to the Special Purpose Vehicles. pay in foreign currency any amounts due to foreign counterparties and from the Fund to the Special Purpose Vehicles. (2) Despite subsection (1), a Special Purpose Vehicle may Despite subsection (1), a Special Purpose Vehicle may borrow money or raise equity in foreign currency from any source without the requirement for any further approval, consent or administrative act of the Government; borrow money or raise equity in foreign currency from any source without the requirement for any further approval, consent or administrative act of the Government; remit to shareholders located outside of the country any dividend derived from a Special Purpose Vehicle or return share capital without any deduction, withholding or other cost, in each case without the requirement for any further approval, consent or administrative act of the Government; remit to shareholders located outside of the country any dividend derived from a Special Purpose Vehicle or return share capital without any deduction, withholding or other cost, in each case without the requirement for any further approval, consent or administrative act of the Government; grant security over any property of a Special Purpose Vehicle or any affiliate in the country or elsewhere to lenders or other creditors or potential creditors, including balances in local and foreign currency bank accounts established onshore or offshore; grant security over any property of a Special Purpose Vehicle or any affiliate in the country or elsewhere to lenders or other creditors or potential creditors, including balances in local and foreign currency bank accounts established onshore or offshore; service or repay foreign loans and pay associated fees and indemnities in any currency without being subject to any tax or withholding tax obligation or deduction unless otherwise provided under this Act; and service or repay foreign loans and pay associated fees and indemnities in any currency without being subject to any tax or withholding tax obligation or deduction unless otherwise provided under this Act; and remit to its lenders any principal, interest, fees or other lending costs owed or payable by a Special Purpose Vehicle or any affiliate in the country without any deduction, withholding tax or other cost unless otherwise provided for under this Act. remit to its lenders any principal, interest, fees or other lending costs owed or payable by a Special Purpose Vehicle or any affiliate in the country without any deduction, withholding tax or other cost unless otherwise provided for under this Act.

provisions.title: Administrative and other expenses of the Fund
provisions.content: The administrative and other expenses related to the management of the Fund including the salaries and wages of employees and officers of the Fund as approved by the Minister shall be charged on the Fund. The administrative and other expenses related to the management of the Fund including the salaries and wages of employees and officers of the Fund as approved by the Minister shall be charged on the Fund.

provisions.title: Tax exemption
provisions.content: The mineral income paid to the Fund and the dividend payable by the Fund or a Special Purpose Vehicle are not taxable. The mineral income paid to the Fund and the dividend payable by the Fund or a Special Purpose Vehicle are not taxable.

provisions.title: Transparency as a fundamental principle
provisions.content: (1) The management of the Fund shall be exercised taking into account The management of the Fund shall be exercised taking into account the overall consideration that minerals income constitutes proceeds from the exploitation of non-renewable natural resources; and the overall consideration that minerals income constitutes proceeds from the exploitation of non-renewable natural resources; and the overall objective that minerals income and minerals investment income is to be managed for the benefit of the current and future generations of citizens of the Republic. the overall objective that minerals income and minerals investment income is to be managed for the benefit of the current and future generations of citizens of the Republic. (2) The management of and duties associated with the Fund shall be carried out in accordance with the highest internationally accepted standards of transparency and good governance. The management of and duties associated with the Fund shall be carried out in accordance with the highest internationally accepted standards of transparency and good governance. (3) The Minister, the Board and the Advisory Committee in the performance of their functions under this Act, shall take the necessary measures to entrench transparency, accountability and free access by the public to information. The Minister, the Board and the Advisory Committee in the performance of their functions under this Act, shall take the necessary measures to entrench transparency, accountability and free access by the public to information. (4) The Board shall ensure that the annual reports of the Fund are readily available to the public. The Board shall ensure that the annual reports of the Fund are readily available to the public.

provisions.title: Accounts and audit
provisions.content: (1) The Board shall keep the books, records, returns of account and other documents relevant to the accounts in the form approved by the Auditor-General. The Board shall keep the books, records, returns of account and other documents relevant to the accounts in the form approved by the Auditor-General. (2) The Board shall submit the accounts of the Fund to the Auditor-General for audit within three months after the end of the financial year. The Board shall submit the accounts of the Fund to the Auditor-General for audit within three months after the end of the financial year. (3) The Auditor-General shall, within six months after the end of the immediately preceding financial year audit the accounts and forward a copy each of the audit report to the Minister and the Board. The Auditor-General shall, within six months after the end of the immediately preceding financial year audit the accounts and forward a copy each of the audit report to the Minister and the Board. (4) The financial year of the Fund is the same as the financial year of the Government. The financial year of the Fund is the same as the financial year of the Government.

provisions.title: Annual report and other reports
provisions.content: (1) The Board shall within one month after receipt of the audit report, submit an annual report to the Minister covering the activities and operations of the Fund for the year to which the report relates. The Board shall within one month after receipt of the audit report, submit an annual report to the Minister covering the activities and operations of the Fund for the year to which the report relates. (2) The annual report shall include The annual report shall include information on the minerals income and minerals investment income receipts for the financial year; information on the minerals income and minerals investment income receipts for the financial year; report of the Auditor-General; and report of the Auditor-General; and a report on the performance of the Fund relative to its statutory objects. a report on the performance of the Fund relative to its statutory objects. (3) The Minister shall, within one month after the receipt of the annual report, submit the report to Parliament with a statements, that the Minister considers necessary. The Minister shall, within one month after the receipt of the annual report, submit the report to Parliament with a statements, that the Minister considers necessary. (4) The Board shall submit to the Minister any other report which the Minister may require in writing. The Board shall submit to the Minister any other report which the Minister may require in writing.

provisions.title: Investment Guidelines and codes of practice
provisions.content: (1) The Board shall, in consultation with the Minister, issue Investment Guidelines in pursuance of the objects of the Fund. The Board shall, in consultation with the Minister, issue Investment Guidelines in pursuance of the objects of the Fund. (2) The Board shall in consultation with the Minister, update the Investment Guidelines to reflect prevailing economic circumstances. The Board shall in consultation with the Minister, update the Investment Guidelines to reflect prevailing economic circumstances. (3) The Board may develop, adopt and, as appropriate amend, revoke or supplement appropriate codes of practice, or procedures consistent with this Act. The Board may develop, adopt and, as appropriate amend, revoke or supplement appropriate codes of practice, or procedures consistent with this Act.

provisions.title: Stability agreement
provisions.content: (1) The Minister may enter into a tripartite stability agreement with the Fund and a Special Purpose Vehicle The Minister may enter into a tripartite stability agreement with the Fund and a Special Purpose Vehicle (2) An agreement entered into under subsection (1) shall not be adversely affected by An agreement entered into under subsection (1) shall not be adversely affected by a new enactment, rule, regulation, instrument, an order made, action taken or changes to a new enactment, rule, regulation, instrument, an order made, action taken or changes to an enactment, an enactment, rule, rule, regulation, regulation, instrument instrument order made, order made, that has the effect or purports to have the effect of imposing obligations on the Fund or Special Purpose Vehicle; subsequent changes to subsequent changes to the level and payment of royalties, taxes, fees and other fiscal imposts, and the level and payment of royalties, taxes, fees and other fiscal imposts, and laws relating to exchange control, transfer of capital and dividend remittance. laws relating to exchange control, transfer of capital and dividend remittance. (3) A stability agreement may also A stability agreement may also commit the Republic to cause the Fund to comply with its obligations under an allocation agreement; commit the Republic to cause the Fund to comply with its obligations under an allocation agreement; provide that the Republic shall not exercise its rights to receive minerals income in kind and shall instead continue to receive and have paid directly into the Fund minerals income in cash; provide that the Republic shall not exercise its rights to receive minerals income in kind and shall instead continue to receive and have paid directly into the Fund minerals income in cash; commit the Republic to exercise the rights of the Republic to obtain the carried interest under the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) and any applicable Mineral Investment Agreements; and commit the Republic to exercise the rights of the Republic to obtain the carried interest under the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) and any applicable Mineral Investment Agreements; and commit the Republic to enforce its rights to collect minerals income under the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) and applicable Mineral Investment Agreements. commit the Republic to enforce its rights to collect minerals income under the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) and applicable Mineral Investment Agreements. (4) A stability agreement entered into under subsection (1) is subject to ratification by Parliament. A stability agreement entered into under subsection (1) is subject to ratification by Parliament.

provisions.title: Allocation agreement
provisions.content: (1) The Fund may enter into one or more allocation agreements with The Fund may enter into one or more allocation agreements with a Special Purpose Vehicle; or a Special Purpose Vehicle; or an entity other than a Special Purpose Vehicle. an entity other than a Special Purpose Vehicle. (2) An allocation agreement may provide for An allocation agreement may provide for the assignment or transfer of all or any portion of the rights of the Fund to minerals income or minerals equity interests to a Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity; and the assignment or transfer of all or any portion of the rights of the Fund to minerals income or minerals equity interests to a Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity; and the manner in which the Fund shall consult and cooperate with a Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity which is a party to the allocation agreement in relation to the manner in which the Fund shall consult and cooperate with a Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity which is a party to the allocation agreement in relation to the audit of minerals income which the Fund has assigned or transferred to the Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity; and the audit of minerals income which the Fund has assigned or transferred to the Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity; and the enforcement of the rights of the Republic and the Fund in respect of the non-payment or receipt of the minerals income. the enforcement of the rights of the Republic and the Fund in respect of the non-payment or receipt of the minerals income. (3) An allocation agreement is subject to ratification by Parliament. An allocation agreement is subject to ratification by Parliament.

provisions.title: Security and guarantee
provisions.content: The Minister may, in writing, guarantee the performance by the Fund of its obligations under any agreement to which the Fund is a party. The Minister may, in writing, guarantee the performance by the Fund of its obligations under any agreement to which the Fund is a party.

provisions.title: Offences and penalties
provisions.content: (1) A person who A person who misappropriates moneys or other assets of the Fund; misappropriates moneys or other assets of the Fund; defrauds, attempts to defraud or conspires with another person to defraud the Fund; or defrauds, attempts to defraud or conspires with another person to defraud the Fund; or uses, attempts to use or conspires with another person to use proprietary or confidential information of the Fund or documents relating to the Fund for personal benefit or advantage or for the personal advantage or benefit of another person; uses, attempts to use or conspires with another person to use proprietary or confidential information of the Fund or documents relating to the Fund for personal benefit or advantage or for the personal advantage or benefit of another person; commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than five hundred thousand penalty units and not more than two million penalty units or a term of imprisonment not less than fifteen years or to both. (2) A person is not liable under paragraph (c) of subsection (1) if the use of information was authorized by the Board with the consent of the Minister. A person is not liable under paragraph (c) of subsection (1) if the use of information was authorized by the Board with the consent of the Minister. (3) A person who without authorization discloses the content of any confidential document or information pertaining to the operations of the Fund commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than twenty five thousand penalty units or to not more than fifty thousand penalty units or a term of imprisonment of not less than two years and not more than five years or both. A person who without authorization discloses the content of any confidential document or information pertaining to the operations of the Fund commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than twenty five thousand penalty units or to not more than fifty thousand penalty units or a term of imprisonment of not less than two years and not more than five years or both. (4) Where the offence committed is by a body corporate, that body corporate is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than seven hundred and fifty thousand penalty units and not more than three million penalty unit. Where the offence committed is by a body corporate, that body corporate is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than seven hundred and fifty thousand penalty units and not more than three million penalty unit. (4) A fine imposed under subsection (4) that is not paid when it is due shall attract an additional penalty of five percent of the original amount for each day of default. A fine imposed under subsection (4) that is not paid when it is due shall attract an additional penalty of five percent of the original amount for each day of default.

provisions.title: Regulations
provisions.content: The Minister may, by legislative instrument, make Regulations for the effective implementation of this Act. The Minister may, by legislative instrument, make Regulations for the effective implementation of this Act.

provisions.title: Interpretation
provisions.content: In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,“allocation agreement” means an agreement between the Fund and a Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity(a)by which the Fund assigns all or a portion of minerals income by way of investment to the special purpose vehicle or other entity; and(b)which defines the relationship between the Fund and the special purpose vehicle or other entity;“Advisory Committee” means the Committee established under section 13;“Board” means the governing body of the Fund established in accordance with section 5;“dividend” means the dividends due the Republic from its equity interests held in mining companies;“Fund” means the Minerals Income Investment Fund established under section 1;“Ghana Revenue Authority” means the Authority established under section 1 of the Ghana Revenue Authority Act, 2009 (Act 791);“Investment Guidelines” means guidelines issued by the Board in consultation with the Minister, to be adhered to in respect of the investments of the Fund and any other Special Purpose Vehicle;“mineral” means a substance in solid or liquid form that occurs naturally in or on the earth, or on or under the seabed, formed by or subject to geological process including industrial minerals but does not include(a)petroleum as defined in the Petroleum (Exploration and Production) Act, 2016 (Act 919);(b)water; and(c)bauxite;“Minerals Development Fund” means the Fund established under section 1 of the Minerals Development Fund Act 2016 (Act 912);"minerals equity interest" means(a)any direct or indirect equity or similar interest of the Republic in a mining company;(b)any right of the Republic to receive dividends and other guaranteed amounts whether or not associated with an equity interest and whether under law or contract from a mining company; and(c)any right of the Republic to receive amounts under arrangements entered into pursuant to a Mining Investment Agreement to satisfy section 43 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703);“minerals income” means(a)any mineral royalties; and(b)any amount of money payable to the Republic on account of a minerals equity interest including any divestment or sale of that equity interest;“Minerals Investment Agreement” means any agreement entered into by and between a mining company and the Republic or any agency of the Republic pursuant to section 48 or 49 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) or any equivalent preceding legislation;“minerals investment income” means returns on investments of minerals income, including dividends, distributions, interest or other payments from a Special Purpose Vehicle or other entity;“minerals operations” include reconnaissance, prospecting or mining for or of minerals;“mineral royalties” means(a)amounts payable under section 25 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703); and(b)any other royalty payable by a mining company to the Republic whether or not linked to a of the value of extracted minerals in respect of mineral production pursuant to a Mining Investment Agreement;“mining company” means a company(a)which is the holder of a mining lease, restricted mining lease or small scale mining lease or the beneficiary of a stability agreement or development agreement entered into pursuant to sections 48 or 49 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703); and(b)the business of which relates primarily to the mining, processing, and sale of minerals or the revenue of which is predominantly attributable to the mining, processing, and sale of minerals;“Minister” means the Minister responsible for Finance;“Ministry” means the Ministry of Finance; and“Special Purpose Vehicle” means an entity created by the Fund, to receive minerals income assigned by the Fund and into which investors may invest or for the purpose of a joint venture. any mineral royalties; and any amount of money payable to the Republic on account of a minerals equity interest including any divestment or sale of that equity interest; “Minerals Investment Agreement” means any agreement entered into by and between a mining company and the Republic or any agency of the Republic pursuant to section 48 or 49 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703) or any equivalent preceding legislation; amounts payable under section 25 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703); and any other royalty payable by a mining company to the Republic whether or not linked to a of the value of extracted minerals in respect of mineral production pursuant to a Mining Investment Agreement; which is the holder of a mining lease, restricted mining lease or small scale mining lease or the beneficiary of a stability agreement or development agreement entered into pursuant to sections 48 or 49 of the Minerals and Mining Act, 2006 (Act 703); “Ministry” means the Ministry of Finance; and “Special Purpose Vehicle” means an entity created by the Fund, to receive minerals income assigned by the Fund and into which investors may invest or for the purpose of a joint venture.
